Interface ServiceOrdersManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServiceOrdersManager

    public interface ServiceOrdersManagerInterface
    This class that holds all the service order objects in the ordered linked-lists that keep the objects ordered based on a particular key. This class adds to the data structures (Start Service) and deletes from the data structures (Finish Service). It also returns the contents of the ordered linked lists. Used for Assignment 2 Spring 2015
    Author:
    original version by Professor Karchner

      Returns the reference to the order number if found or null if not found

      Removes the Service Order from the ordered linked lists

      Returns a two dimensional array of Strings to populate a JTable

      boolean startService(int orderNum, java.lang.String owner, java.lang.String make, java.lang.String model, java.lang.String oilChange, java.lang.String safetyCheck, java.lang.String emissionsCheck)
      Creates a Service Order object and adds it to the ordered linked lists
      boolean startService(ServiceOrder order)
      Adds a Service Order to the ordered linked lists.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string with all the current Service Orders in the following format: Line Information 1 Order # (integer) 2 Owner (last name, first name) (String) 3 make (String) 4 model (String) 5 oilChange (String) either "yes" or "no" 6 safetyCheck (String) either "yes" or "no" 7 emissionsCheck (String) either "yes" or "no" ** No blank lines between Service Orders

    • Method Detail

      • startService

        boolean startService(int orderNum,
                     java.lang.String owner,
                     java.lang.String make,
                     java.lang.String model,
                     java.lang.String oilChange,
                     java.lang.String safetyCheck,
                     java.lang.String emissionsCheck)
              throws ServiceException
        Creates a Service Order object and adds it to the ordered linked lists
        Parameters:
        orderNum - service order number
        owner - name of owner
        make - make of car
        model - model of car
        oilChange - oil check
        safetyCheck - safety check
        emissionsCheck - emission test check
        Returns:
        true if added, and false if order not added
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if Service Order Number is already in use

      • startService

        boolean startService(ServiceOrder order)
              throws ServiceException
        Adds a Service Order to the ordered linked lists. This is for testing purposes. Not intended to be used by the user
        Parameters:
        order - a Service Order to be added to the ordered linked lists.
        Returns:
        true if the startService was successful
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if Service Order Number is already in use

      • finishService

        boolean finishService(int orderNum)
               throws ServiceException
        Removes the Service Order from the ordered linked lists
        Parameters:
        orderNum - Service Order Number
        Returns:
        true if the finishService is successful
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if the Service Order Number is not found

      • listByKeyTable

        java.lang.String[][] listByKeyTable(int key)
        Returns a two dimensional array of Strings to populate a JTable
        Parameters:
        key, - how service orders are to be ordered 1 = service order number, 2 = owner name (last, first), 3 = model
        Returns:
        a two dimensional array of Strings to populate a JTable order for key 1 = order num, owner, make, model, oilChange, safetyCheck, emissionsCheck order for key 2 = owner, order num, make, model, oilChange, safetyCheck, emissionsCheck order for key 3 = model, owner, make, order num, oilChange, safetyCheck, emissionsCheck

      • listByKeyVector

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> listByKeyVector(int key)
        Returns a Vector of Strings to populate a JList
        Parameters:
        key - how service orders are to be ordered 1 = service order number, 2 = owner name (last, first), 3 = model
        Returns:
        a Vector of Strings to populate a JList order for key 1 = order num, owner, make, model, oilChange, safetyCheck, emissionsCheck order for key 2 = owner, order num, make, model, oilChange, safetyCheck, emissionsCheck order for key 3 = model, owner, make, order num, oilChange, safetyCheck, emissionsCheck

      • findOrderNum

        ServiceOrder findOrderNum(int orderNum)
        Returns the reference to the order number if found or null if not found
        Parameters:
        orderNum - the order number to look for
        Returns:
        the reference to the service order object or null if not found

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string with all the current Service Orders in the following format: Line Information 1 Order # (integer) 2 Owner (last name, first name) (String) 3 make (String) 4 model (String) 5 oilChange (String) either "yes" or "no" 6 safetyCheck (String) either "yes" or "no" 7 emissionsCheck (String) either "yes" or "no" ** No blank lines between Service Orders
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String that can be used with a PrintWriter object to write to a file.
